anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr13938 [Fujiko Fujio A]`s horror manga. In a society filled with people who do whatever with their lives, there are some who struggle with it or never achieved their goals. The story focuses on individuals who meet a shadowy and ominous salesman, http://anidb.net/ch86705 [Moguro Fukuzou], who promises them a better life if they follow his advice. However, the clients that Moguro meet often cheat, refuse to rely on his help, or worse - deny that they received assistance at all. When this invariably happens, Fukuzou punishes his clients by using their reliance on his aid against them. With their lives ruined, he is satisfied with his job and looks for more potential clients. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: alcohol
tag.description: Alcohol (or more scientifically, ethanol), is one of the world`s oldest psychoactive substances. It is traditionally found in the form of a beverage such as beer, wine, or liquor, although in some contexts it can be inhaled to produce similar or intoxication, and some people prefer another way of consuming beverage-form alcohol. Alcoholic beverages are many and varied, due to production methods (fermentation or distillation), source materials (grains, fruits, vegetables, other plants), added substances such as flavorings, and many more ways of defining different forms of alcoholic beverages. Alcoholic beverages are divided into three general classes: beers, wines, and spirits. They are legally consumed in most countries, and over 100 countries have laws regulating their production, sale, and consumption. In particular, such laws specify the minimum age at which a person may legally buy or drink them. This minimum age varies between 16 and 25 years, depending upon the country and the type of drink. Most nations set it at 18 years of age.

tag.name: working life
tag.description: The life of someone actually working on a often less than glamorous job is depicted in this anime. The job is taxing and the pay is low, not really the dream job one would choose to work in. Examples: Working as salesperson in a department store, or as a waitress in a family restaurant.

tag.name: drastic change of life
tag.description: One or more characters in this series go through an event that makes them change their way of life drastically and permanently. This change might be voluntary, or against the character`s will. Some examples might be an accident, the gaining of superpowers, or simply graduating.

tag.name: be careful what you wish for
tag.description: Be careful what you wish for... your wish may actually come true. This is an age-old philosophical problem of what human beings think they want and what is actually good for them. The power to wish for anything can be very dangerous and usually — as a moral lesson — yields unexpected / unwanted results. A contract with the devil is a specific case of this; receiving great power, especially from a devil, is usually a double edged sword.

tag.name: dysfunctional family
tag.description: When the nuclear family (Mother, Father and child(ren)) goes boom due to conflicts between family members, sometimes resulting in the breakup of the family or even violence.

tag.name: CAST MISSING
tag.description: Important characters are missing, either in-part or entirely. This includes basic entry info (name, gender, picture), appear episode range, seiyuu and/or tags.

tag.name: black humour
tag.description: Sure, it`s funny, but you really shouldn`t be laughing... In other words, it`s a comedy that employs situations that nice people should not be laughing about.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: multi-segment episodes
tag.description: Multi-segment episodes are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t5852 [short episodes], which are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length (up to and including 10 minutes). Also not to be confused with an OVA or music video with multiple (otherwise unrelated) full-length http://anidb.net/t7241 [bundled episodes] consolidated into a single episode video track.

tag.name: Anime no Me
tag.description: Anime no Me was an anime brand and programming block by http://anidb.net/cr917 [TMS Entertainment], http://anidb.net/cr1284 [Shin-Ei Animation], East Japan Marketing & Communications, Inc., Sumitomo Corporation, and http://anidb.net/cr36685 [Asmik-Ace]. It ran from July 2016 to March 2018. The "Me" in its name means "eye" and refers to the eye of a typhoon.

episode.title: プラットホームの女 / 走行者天国
The Woman on the Platform / Runners` Paradise
La fille sur le quai – Le Paradis des coureurs
Platform no Onna / Soukousha Tengoku
episode.summary: Part A: Naoki Junichi was in love with a woman he’d always see at the train station platform. Moguro notices this and tells him that he’ll bring the two together. Despite having some suspicions about Moguro, Naoki’s feelings for the woman only grow stronger... Part B: Michihara Kakeru had been running to relieve stress from his job. However, there have been a lot more runners lately and it was getting a bit crowded, which was causing him even more stress. Moguro notices this and hands Michihara a... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 弁当戦争 / ああ, 愛しの583系
Bento Wars / Ah, My Beloved 583-Type
La guerre des bentos – Ah, 583 adoré
Bentou Sensou / Aa, Itoshi no 583 Kei
episode.summary:
Amae Masao has his mother make him a bento every day, but he was actually switching that bento with his girlfriend in secret. He and his girlfriend end up getting in a fight over the bentos, and he seeks help from Moguro, but...
Part B Kamera Tetsuya’s work life and hobbies aren’t going very well lately, so Moguro pulls some strings and allows him to ride the 583-Type that he had so many fond memories on. Kamera is moved by the gesture, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 温泉奇行 / マボロシガイシャ
Hot Spring Eccentricity / Fantasy Company
Folies aux sources chaudes – Un emploi de rêve
Onsen Kikou / Maboroshi Gaisha
episode.summary: Part A: On his way back from a business trip, Kihara stops by a hot springs town and runs into Moguro. After that, they have some fun with some geishas. Kihara has too much to drink and passes out. Moguro then creates an opportunity for him to have the night of his dreams... Part B: Deyashiro ends up quitting his job and starts going to the Fantasy Company through a referral by Moguro. The purpose of that company was to retrain people in order to be able to enter the work force again... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 白昼夢 / ご利用は計画的に
Daydream / Make a Budget and Stick to It
Rêve éveillé – Un contrat est un contrat
Hakuchuumu / Goriyou wa Keikakuteki ni
episode.summary: Part A: Nakajima and Sakamaki work in a certain office and one day, Sakamaki offers to take Nakajima to a certain place for lunch. The place happened to be a club named “Daydream” that was in the basement of the same building that their office was in. There, Nakajima meets Moguro and is warned, but ends up falling for a pretty hostess named Haruka. Part B: Mitsuko had been shopping excessively in order to relieve the stress she was feeling from work. One day while she was out shopping, Moguro talks to her. Despite having some doubts, she ends up taking up his invitation and meets him at Bar Ma no Su... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending
Opening
夢に追われる男 / ひげタクシー
The Man Chased by His Dreams / Mustache Taxi
Victime de ses rêves – Le taxi moustachu
Yume ni Owareru Otoko / Hige Taxi
episode.summary: Part A: Yumemi Ashi is haunted by a nightmare every day and one day, he meets Moguro, and opens up about his troubles. He then receives a special candy that lets him control dreams, but... Part B: Taxi driver, Yowagoshi, is too meek to deal with rowdy customers and was troubled. He then meets Moguro, who gives him a certain item. What could this item be? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 化けた男 / ママ友のおきて
The Man Who Transformed / The Rule of Mommy Friends
La métamorphose – Le clan des mamans
Baketa Otoko / Mama Tomo no Okite
episode.summary:
Part A: Isobe has a kind wife, a lovely little daughter, and a perfect home life, but he still felt like something was missing. One day, he runs into Moguro and realizes that he wants a life with a little more intensity...
Part B: The head of a mommy friend group named Oniyo complains about every little thing she finds displeasing. Shizuoka Nozomi is a part of the group, and just like the others, never argues with her. One day, Nozomi meets Moguro, and he brings back a series of peaceful days for her, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かいぶつかします / 今夜も最高
I`ll Lease This Monster / Tonight`s Another Awesome Night
Un succès monstre – Encore une nuit
Kaibutsu Kashimasu / Kon`ya mo Saikou
episode.summary:
Part A: Udo is an actor who can barely get any work because of his huge body. Because he ends up attracting more attention than the lead actor, he is even let go from the role of a passerby. He then runs into Moguro and receives some advice. He then manages to get much more popular, but...
Part B: Doraki spends many of his nights late night at a family restaurant. Doraki is quite the night owl and his schedule had been becoming completely opposite than his girlfriend’s and it was troubling him. One day, Moguro gives him an item that’ll help him become a day person, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 日曜クラブ / 捨てちゃう女
Sunday Club / The Woman Who Throws Away
Le cercle du dimanche – Une femme minimaliste
Nichiyou Club / Sutechau Onna
episode.summary: Part A: Uchinaki gets his foot stepped on by Moguro one morning on the rush hour train. To make it up to him, Moguro treats him to a cup of coffee. Uchinaki then talks about his depression concerning work, which leads to Moguro leading him to a dream-like place... Part B: Monomochi Tomie is living the dream with the perfect home and perfect family, however her heart still seemed empty. Moguro then introduces her to someone who manages to convince her that she needs to declutter her life. She then starts decluttering, but ends up not being able to throw things away, and something awful happens. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チャットルームの王様 / ニッポン海外旅行
The King of the Chat Room / Japan Overseas Trip
Le roi du chat – Voyage à l’étranger
Chat Room no Ou-sama / Nippon Kaigairyokou
episode.summary: Amikumo Tsuyoshi enjoys chatting with people he doesn’t know online, but ends up in an argument with one of the random people. He eventually ends up kicked out of the chatroom. He then receives something from Moguro and attempts to get revenge, but... Chikako wants to go on a vacation somewhere someday, but her stingy nature has prevented her from doing so. She then meets Moguro, who tells her about a ridiculously cheap vacation package, and she just can’t say no. However, there was a catch that no one would’ve expected... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 破滅症患者 / 私はアイドル
Destructive Tendencies / I`m an Idol
Pulsions autodestructrices – Je suis une idole
Hametsushou Kansha / Watashi wa Idol
episode.summary:
Part A: Ochiiri has a great home and loving wife. He lives a life that everyone would be envious of, but he had a problem that he couldn’t mention to anyone. One day, he happens to encounter Moguro in a dark alleyway and ends up telling him his secret that he couldn’t even tell his wife.
Part B: Mamano Ari works hard to make her daughter’s dream of becoming a top idol come true. Ari had no doubts that her daughter would succeed. Ari encounters Moguro one day and he warns her about something, but she doesn’t listen. However, she receives shocking news from her daughter... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 拾ったフィルムのヒト / ウソ孫
The Person in the Acquired Film / Fake Grandchild
La fille des photos égarées – Le petit-fils de substitution
Hirotta Film no Hito / Uso Mago
episode.summary:
Part A: Tayori ends up getting film that doesn’t belong to him developed, and falling in love with the woman in the pictures. He ends up asking Moguro to help him meet her. Despite all the uncertainty, he goes to meet her and something insane happens!
Part B: Oite Kazuhito just retired from his job that he had been at for many years. As soon as he got home, there were divorce papers from his wife waiting for him. After that, he was living a lonely life, unable to see his granddaughter. Then one day, Moguro comes up with an idea... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 懐かしの銭湯ツアー / 研究者はユウウツ
The Nostalgic Bathhouse Tour / The Researcher`s Melancholy
La tournée des bains publics d’antan – La solitude du chercheur
Natsukashi no Sentou Tour / Kenkyuusha wa Yuuutsu
episode.summary:
Part A: Bandai Mamoru has a hobby of admiring bathhouse paintings. One day, he visits a bathhouse like he usually does, and runs into Moguro and they talk about bathhouses. The next day, Moguro tells him that he’s located the illusive bathhouse painting, and he takes him to...
Part B: Towani works as a university researcher, but he gets his research stolen by his ex-girlfriend. One night as he’s out drinking, he runs into Moguro. Moguro then gives Towani a certain offer... Source: crunchyroll
